website_summaries.verdict: Excellent compact knife system that fits tight in the sheath. Well-constructed blade resists corrosion problems.
pros: Compact skeletal frame with indention for finger
Ceramic coating on blade prevents corrosion
Includes sheath for carrying in a vertical or horizontal position on a belt
Works well for processing small game
cons: Blade tends to dull fairly quickly
Handle coating doesn't last very long
Knife is too light for some people

customer_reviews.title: Apparently isn’t built to last
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this knife a week ago and the rubber on the handle is wearing off. I have only worn it to work and I work 24 hours every 3rd day.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, great holster.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the knife for a month of training in Southern California (NTC) held an edge pretty well. Did have to sharpen it after some use. Cover over the handle did not hold up well, but the knife itself and the holster worked great. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tim The Tool Guy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. It feels great. It came super sharp. The sheath is especially nice when I am in uniform, I am always able to grab it quickly when I need to. I bought a second one just for my civilian clothes. I have been looking for a knife for months that; A) Fits on my belt sideways and is comfortable. B) Looks cool. For some reason I always found B. If I was to say anything bad about this knife it would be that it does not have the option for a combo edge but either way I highly, highly, highly recommend this knife to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jon I.

customer_reviews.title: Fixed blade for the chest rig
customer_reviews.text: I am a Gerber fan, carried a MK 2 and MK 1 for some time. I was looking for a fixed blade utility knife for my vest. My vest is not my primary load out, but in a pinch, and with something close it's fine. I didn't need a monster fixed blade but something usable and the Ghost strike is now it. perfect size to tuck in behind the pistol holster and seems sturdy enough for the tasks I expect to need it for. Not an LMF or a Prodigy, but it'll do what I want it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is awesome. It comes sharp out of the box and the holster works great. I use it a lot around the house. Wearing it around your ankle with shorts on or vertically on your hip with your shirt tucked under it is generally ok for carrying in public in areas like California where it is illegal to conceal a "dirk or dagger" in public, but make sure you check your local knife laws before purchasing. Fits perfectly in the holster every time and I have had it for about 5 months now and haven't had any problems with the rubber grip wearing down like some of the other revierws have stated.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: people who know nothing about knives give this good reviews
customer_reviews.text: you cannot put a metal retaining bar into a sheath that comes in direct contact with the blade and have a sharp knife .... anyone who owns this knife, get it right now and try to shave arm hair, or just cut the edge of a sheet of paper. guarantee it wont happen, not if you have been using the included sheath. Gerber, what happened to the quality of your products ???
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! ! ! ! ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a knife I could carry on the back of my belt for awhile now and this one couldn’t be more perfect. Because of its slim design I forget I’m even wearing it! I was worried about the sheath not being strong enough to hold the blade secure but it works great. While most of the sheath is plastic there are two metal pins that lock the blade tightly in place. They also cause it to make a really satisfying sound when you draw and sheath it. It’s a EDC for me and now several of my friends I’ve recommended it to. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Great knives for the Amazon price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for $35 on Amazon. And I do not regret it. I plan to us it as a back up knife for self defense. I have EDC knives that I use, and they serve their purpose. The one thing I like about this knife is that it has screws for the belt loop attachments that come with it. So I thought about tek lock, so I bought a couple of them here as well thinking the holes would align, and I was wrong, but luckily the sheath has a space big enough to improvise. So its semi tek lok compatible, and I have a random strap so I can strap it to my ankle as well.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for EDC! Poor handle material!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I saw a friend had recently purchased one and I was entrigued by the blade/handle and the sheath. I wear it everyday on my belt at my lower back and forget it’s ever there never snags on anything or gets in the way. The blade is very securely held in place with no worries of falling out on its own. If you’re looking for a discreet knives this is the one. Now with the handle it’s a rubberized material feels great and looks good but does not last at all. I tore it off and replaced it with 550 cord. Now I have a knife and about a foot of 550 cord if ever need be.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: To start off this is a great little knife my main issues are that for some reason the carrying sheath duals out the blade which is a tad bit frustrating. My rubber grip hasn’t come off yet but only been wearing it for a few days. I like the fact you can carry it horizontally on a belt the blade can go in the sheath both ways. Wish it came with a actual clip I’m going to obtain on and see how it works out instead of belt loops. Overall nice knife good quality only down side the knife does have a little movement in the sheath the retention is good so someone couldn’t easily grab it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for horizontal concealing
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is the size of the belt loops. I mostly wear braided belts and they are very hard to get through the belt loops on the knife holster. If you wear thin belts, this won't be an issue, however. I replaced a larger knife with this one as it doesn't stick out too far when its worn horizontally on your belt. Perfect for my left hand in the event I'm unable to reach and pull out my pistol that's mounted on the right side of my belt. The knife's very expensive, but everything appears to be well-made.
customer_reviews.author: kgod

customer_reviews.title: Good utility knife
customer_reviews.text: The main reasons why I decided to purchase this knife was because I wanted a good sheath, dark finish, small size for concealment, lightweight, and quality/price knife steel. When I received it, the knife matched my criteria and was satisfied with my purchase. The reason why I gave it 4 stars, is the grip is not very durable. The rubber grip seems to wear off even with moderate use. Other people do mention that, and it does not affect the overall performance of the knife. The grip was more durable, the knife would easily get the 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife, Awful Sheath
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, terrible sheath. The blade did need some sharpening out of the box, which is fine, but the sheath is what gets me. It’s discreet but not terribly ergonomic for big hands. I can only manage to get a couple fingers securely around the handle when drawing. In a high tension, quick draw situation, I would not be able to grab the knife with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love it, versatile and adaptive. Scored a great deal vs sportsman's Warehouse. My only draw back is the rubber coating on the handle is coming off. Seems to get caught on everything. I'm constantly getting snagged when in tight spaces or getting in the car. Still super handy but I think I need a knife maybe an inch shorter on the small of my back. This also might just be a physical feature different for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Petarra

customer_reviews.title: great knife.
customer_reviews.text: this is the second one ive owned, the first was stolen from my luggage by a tsa agent on my way to work, so i had to get another. the retention in the sheath is excellent i never have to worry about it coming out of the sheath unless i mean to pull it out. the only issue i had with the first knife was after carrying it everyday for about a month, the rubber around lanyard hole on the handle of the knife wore away so i had to use electrical tape around it. other than that the knife is excellent. the knife is extremely easy to conceal and very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Concealed Carry Knife
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a great concealed carry knife that is easily hidden, light weight but strong enough for real self defense? This is something you should consider. If you are trained in kali you will love this little knife. Stays secure in the sheath yest easy to deploy if needed, Usually I am not a big fan of Gerber knives, but my instructor had one and we tested it and after that I was sold. Take a look at it and I think you will like it,
customer_reviews.author: GMan

customer_reviews.title: Great but please know
customer_reviews.text: This knife is great, I carry almost everyday for the past few months that I have owned. The only issues that I have with this is the handle coating does wear out as seen on the attached picture. If you carry in the small.of tour back be advised that it can wear out your shirts. The past few months my wife has noticed small holes in the tails of some of my shirts. Today I am wearing a Eddie Bauer polo shirt and it has worn a few small holes in the back. This has caused me to change the position while I carry. Still a great knife
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Came Used
customer_reviews.text: My knife was CLEARLY USED and must of been returned, I open the package there’s no wrapping just the knife in the product box, the knife was also put upside down in the sheaf and there was little marks on the ceramic showing it has been used, it’s very hard to pull out and will actually move my whole belt trying to pull it out, then putting it back in is just a complete pain, it won’t fit and u have to push in and out and adjust untill it clicks in, that is the obvious reason it was returned. Other then that the knife seems cool but now ummm returning and have to order HOPEFULLY A NEW ONE.
customer_reviews.author: rg

customer_reviews.title: I love the holster of the blade
customer_reviews.text: I love the holster of the blade. Makes a nice clicking noise so you know it’ll stay put. What I hated about the knife is the handle. I mostly had this knife holstered horizontally on my mid back and rarely pulled it out or used it. But the handle of the blade has worn off and it’s a uncomfortable feeling when trying to grab it.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Kim Dao

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, but beware of rubber peeling
customer_reviews.text: Over time rubber coating starts to wear off, great concept of a knife, execution can be a little better, holds a decent edge, where this product really shines is it’s conceal-ability, it allows me to carry a fixed blade at work for work purposes without being obnoxious with a vertical belt mount. Overall great buy, but beware the rubber will peel with use. I wish it was more like the gerber strong arm series grips, though other than that it really holds to gerbers standards
customer_reviews.author: Ben H.

customer_reviews.title: Range belt knife
customer_reviews.text: I attached it to my range/shooting belt and it fits perfectly and is very sleek/low-profile. The knife has a nice audible click when being secured into the holster, is securely in place, and is easy to reach. Knife blade can be inserted into the holster in either direction. Great knife.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: The knife is fine probably my folding knife is just as good but ...
customer_reviews.text: Small knife made by Gerber in the USA. Gerber started making knives in China and at that time I stopped buying their knives. I found this one was made in the USA and for that reason and without a real need I purchased the knife. The knife is fine probably my folding knife is just as good but Ill stick this one in my backpack just in case. I really did buy it just because Gerber made it in the USA and I wanted to support them in that decision.
customer_reviews.author: mikec

customer_reviews.title: Decent Blade, Terrible Grip
customer_reviews.text: as many other reviews have noted the rubber grip it comes with is trash. I bought it to carry on a recent trip to Colorado. Did some light bouldering, mostly just a lot of hiking. By the end of the first day the rubber grip was destroyed. Put a sinew (synthetic) wrap on it and that stood up to the rest of the week-long trip without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephens

customer_reviews.title: The only issue is finding one small enough to make you not look like a serial killer
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to carrying fixed blade knives. The only issue is finding one small enough to make you not look like a serial killer. This fits the bill perfectly. I carry this horizontally on my belt, but the sheath offers many possibilities. The retention on the sheath is great, it stays in during all kinds of activities and motion, it takes enough of a tug where someone passing by couldn't take it out without you knowing it. Only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the blade wasn't as sharp from the box as I would expect from Gerber, especially one of their American made knives.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Poor edge, American made
customer_reviews.text: Most wonky sharpened knife I’ve ever seen. Uneven edge, both from the side, and looking across the edge.since it was sharpened so poorly at the factory, and it’s super high carbon, it took around 5 hours of hand sharpening to fix the edge. Only buy if you’re confident with a sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade arrived dull...very dull
customer_reviews.text: Ok knife but disappointed in how dull blade was. Can rectify that but expected a little more from a Gerber product. Bought primarily for sheath system but after receiving today I kind of wish I had went with the SOG Instinct. Just saw the SOG after I had pulled the trigger on this one. Much better price and has 360 degree sheath which allows for horizontal wear too.
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Still trying to get a feel for ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Still trying to get a feel for where I want to carry on my belt, definitely will always be in the horizontal position. Kind of like it flat on the back of my waist, but at the same time, like it on my left side as I am right-handed and can reach across comfortably and grab and go with it. The only draw back is the rubberish coating on the handle is coming off on the corner already, but that if fine with me. I can always do a 550 para-cord grip on it once it all comes off... will have additional cordage with me that way... to me, no harm, no foul for this.
customer_reviews.author: The Bearded One

customer_reviews.title: Amasing knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same blade from a pawn shop about 8 years ago. It served me well through the times. But sadly flying I wasnt allowed to bring it with me and it got lost. So happy i found this blade again i missed having this one. It has an amazing case that has never let me down. And the blade in general is solid. It stays pretty sharp.
customer_reviews.author: kibanoko

customer_reviews.title: Knife good, sheath bad :-/
customer_reviews.text: It is a great little knife, but the sheath (IMO) kind is lacking. I tried side draw, straight up draw and neither one worked for me so I returned the knife. I think my issues is that it is a thin knife and thus has a thin sheath and it only has one point of contact (one belt loop), so when you draw the knife it is an awkward motion given the lack of stability. Anyway a lot of people like, but it is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice concealable knife!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews have said the rubber grip around the knife has started to rip on mine. After it completely comes off I think wrapping the handle with paracord can do the trick. Other than that the knife clicks into the sheath perfectly with out any complications. Concealment is perfect as well having it under your shirt. And doesn’t stick out of my shirt that much.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Bui

customer_reviews.title: Great utility knife
customer_reviews.text: I’ve carried this knife on the back of my belt for 2 years. I use this knife as a beater/utility. Blade is decent, sharped regularly every week. Pros: -Only hard sheath for belt carry I can find on amazon that is legal size for carry. -Can change to vertical and horizontal. -Light weight. Cons: -Rubber grip ripped off (due to scraping on ground when on my back.) -Light weight. (Not for long/heavy use) Overall would buy again, mainly for the freedom of putting on belt and ankle.
customer_reviews.author: terrence

customer_reviews.title: The holster is not the most space saving design
customer_reviews.text: For a knife designed for concealed carrying behind the belt, the holster itself has adds unnecessary bulk that stretches its total length beyond the length of the knife. This makes its carrying not only less comfortable, but also less concealable as a large part of the knife's handle is constantly sticking out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yuhan Luo

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: So most of the time I have no idea it’s on. If you work in tight spaces and it bumps and scrapes against something the grip will start coming off. The blade comes sharp but lost its edge. Now this all sounds like a horrible review but really I can’t blame it all on how it was made. I work in a brutal environment and the fact that it has held up the way it has impressed me. I am disappointed in the blade though. I’ve had cheaper blades keep their edge longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H. Peery

customer_reviews.title: Gerber concealable knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this knife it's small very sharp and highly concealable I would recommend this knife to anyone who needs a good small sharp concealable knife for self defense.
customer_reviews.author: CrustalDestruction

customer_reviews.title: It's Gerber...what do you need to know?
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply... it's Gerber. This particular knive is evenly balance at the haft due to the solid shank style. The coated rubber is of durable blend and adhesion. Poly sheath is standard with slightly flexible enclosed belt slots mounted by coated screws. Nice addition to the LDK's on my duty gear. Thinking about purchasing another just for my daily dress. Worth every bit of its cost.
customer_reviews.author: ravenest13

customer_reviews.title: Great knife overall, however, the rubber grip doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Gerber makes great knives, I've carried them for a long time. This knife is no exception; very sturdy and small so it's easy to carry. The only problem I have with it is the rubber grip on the handle. If you carry this knife on your belt, in the small of your back, every day; the rubber is bound to come off. After only a few days of carrying this knife the rubber was torn up and peeling off. I carry it without the rubber on the handle now and it still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: alex vielee

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to draw. No way to stay covert.
customer_reviews.text: Very compact. Better for camping than fighting. Well made. Saber style blade. Light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Arge

customer_reviews.title: Good knife sheath could be better
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this knife its small lightweight and the inculcated sheath made it east to carry i carried it horizontally it can be roated to vertically if you want witch i recommend i lost my when i bumped into something the clips that hold it in the sheath dont take a lot to come loose
customer_reviews.author: crabby

customer_reviews.title: Carries well
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium athletic build and like to wear normal fitting clothes. This knife carries well and seems to retain in sheath firmly so far. The option of being able to adjust carry 90 degrees is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Owen

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly knife arrived not sharp by any standard
customer_reviews.text: Very positive engagement with the sheath in and out, I like the grip for a small knife I can feel it I was surprised at the edge on the knife I purchased other knives from this manufacturer arrived razor sharp very satisfactory but this knife was almost dull
customer_reviews.author: Jim Glass

customer_reviews.title: LOVE  IT
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these, 2 in a store, the third on here. I love this knife, its sharp, fits in your hand perfectly (and I have small hands). Its comfortable!!! I have one bolted in my car, to act as a seatbelt cutter in an emergency, one that I carry for work, and one that I carry day to day, the work one is covered in paint, and I abuse it! but hasn't lost its edge!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Haid

customer_reviews.title: Sheath Sucks
customer_reviews.text: The sheath snapped after 1 day of wearing it. Had it position at my 6 horizontally and when I went to sit down, it snapped. Snapped in the exact spot as other pictures so seems to be a common issue. Now I have no way to carry this knife.
customer_reviews.author: david james

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is the first items I've ever felt compelled enough 5o leave a review on. I own alot of knives. As far as my initial impressions, the knife itself is very light and ergonomic, handle is big enough to grip well even with larger hands. The feature I'm most impressed with is the sheath. It's by far and away the best concealable fixed blade in my entire collection. American made and gerber quality. You really cannot go wrong here for a EDC knife for utility and self defense uses.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Small but ended up being what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought it would be but it ended up fitting perfectly on my belt set up. Super comfortable to hold, keeps its edge, very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Had to polish and remove some excess material from the top and bottom of the knife were it snapped into the clips and sharpen the blade since it was so dull. The first one was perfect
customer_reviews.text: Second one I purchased and I had to do some work to the second one in order to draw it from the sheet without pulling my pants off! Had to polish and remove some excess material from the top and bottom of the knife were it snapped into the clips and sharpen the blade since it was so dull. The first one was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J Csizmar

customer_reviews.title: Incredible access, OK knife
customer_reviews.text: The actual knife itself is not great. It is inexpensive and the skeleton-style handle is not comfortable in your hand. However, the knife excels in its accessibility. It is really hard to open a folding knife under stress. But this knife can be easily accessed with either hand and can be put into the sheath in either direction. It can also be concealed on a belt underneath a shirt. For the price, its worth your time.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Used every day.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber handle starts to fall apart after a while. Blade gets dull if used often. Great for someone who would use it on trips or weekends. Great for a hobby knife or weekend guy. I went with something a bit heavier, nicer and bigger for an EDC.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Does that disappoint, great knife to keep with you day to day
customer_reviews.text: Always been a big fan of Gerber, and this night does not disappoint. A great knife to put on your belt, concealed, for a good walk in nature.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Spainhour

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike knife
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife. Came nice and sharp and configured for the inline on a belt, mounted nicely just to the back and under the gas tank on my Harley. Since it's black you can't see it unless your looking for it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easy concealment.  Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy, stealthy knife. Rubber coating peels off quickly. I just added 1/8 paracord to handle (Also cancer warning ladle on side of box) do your research on the chemicals, metals and rubbers used.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Bitchin blade especially for the $$.
customer_reviews.text: Sexy af, sharp af, durability is on point thus far, one and only concern, if you aren't gripping it strong enough when poking or stabbing your hand may slide into the blade due to it not having a blocker at the top of handle, just be careful is common sense e and your good (:
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Undercover protection
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he uses it every single day, it just sucks that the rubber is starting to wear off. However he still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little blade!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little blade!! Light weight, good steel, very sharp blade.
customer_reviews.author: DRomero

customer_reviews.title: Decent Knife but.....
customer_reviews.text: Decent EDC knife for the price. Versatile sheath has good retention of the knife and can be carried vertically or horizontally on belt, or lashed to MOLLE gear. Added 550 cord wrapping to rear half of grip, but could not go further up due to sheath. The knife is locked into sheath with metal pins top and bottom, the blade will drag the bottom pin on the draw causing blade dulling. Blade can also contact belt loop screws also causing dulling on the draw. Otherwise, not a bad knife, but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: scudrunnernrh

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, lightweight, and tough
customer_reviews.text: The knife is lightweight and feels like it can take a beating. The cutting edge is fairly sharp and the handle is rubberized for a strong grip. The sheath holds the knife in without any wiggle and it can be attached to your belt horizontally and it looks like it can be reconfigured to be attached vertically
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Love the way it wears on the lower back horizontally. It's compact, sharp, and just plain cool. Wearing a shirt tucked in feels better than without. After wearing it a couple of times I barely even know it's there even while driving, sitting on the couch, or laying down. Contours nicely. I couldn't find a cooler knife for less than $40.00 with wearing options AND made in America.
customer_reviews.author: Rippenmad29

customer_reviews.title: fits on my belt
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for everyday protection while walking the dog. Very sturdy and well made. Feel safe just having it on me. Would highly recommend for added security.
customer_reviews.author: tami l seelen

customer_reviews.title: Small Self Defense Knife
customer_reviews.text: I like the small form factor of the knife and how it can be easily concealed horizontally in your belt. It is a little bit pricey thought but maybe because of the sheath which is pretty awesome and for being made in the USA. ***Check your local knife laws before taking this with you
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Good knife easy fixable handle
customer_reviews.text: I love the knife also great sheath it fits on the small of my back and I dont even feel it with easy draw a few buddies even bought it they liked it soo much I know not all handles stand up but that's an easy fix if u know wat ur doing u can just dip it in some flex seal from Walgreens or CVS and its permanent ur welcome lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, sturdy, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly one of my favorite knives that I've ever owned and I've had quite a few. The design is very study so I can be rough with it during use without worrying. It's simple design also makes it very easy to clean after using it for dirty tasks. It also helps that both the knife and the case it comes with look very catching.

customer_reviews.title: Dull blade, handle needs work. Has promise.
customer_reviews.text: The grip feels good but it's just too small to fill out most guys hands. The design is great it just needs more to it to feel secure in a self defense application. The blade wasn't sharp AT ALL, so it was sent back.
customer_reviews.author: james williams

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice knife all around
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice knife all around. If you want a no profile I would recommend the ankle attachment. When I attatch it to my belt the butt of the handle poked and shoes throw a shirt and light jacket. Blade didn't seem crazy sharp but just 3 or 4 swipes on a sharpener and it was cutting straight through envelopes and paper. The only problem I have is the sheath is pretty limited. I would just attatch this to my edc bag if I could but the sheath alone seems to only work with somewhat thinner belts.
customer_reviews.author: Jourdon Mazur

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey for the quality
customer_reviews.text: First off this knife is too pricey for what you get. I really like the design of the sheath and blade. Ive had no problems with it as far as that is concerned. It came pretty sharp out of the box and fits nicely in the sheath. But after a week of wearing it everyday to work, the rubber part of the handle started come off. Really disappointed about that. But if you don't mind plasti dipping the handle or wrapping it in para cord, go for it. Defiantly not worth 50$ though.
customer_reviews.author: Graham C.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great slim knife. If you us it horizontal (left to right) to pokes out a little for me but that depends on your body size. Other then that I wish it came with an attachment for a vest.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Loses its edge quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this knife as a companion for my concealed sidearm. The knife feels good in the hand and the low profile sheath is comfortable for long term wear. The only problem is after the knife is drawn two or three times it loses its edge. This is due to it rolling over the keeper pins. I think that the knife material needs to be harder. Is this a deal breaker, not really but you need to be aware of this problem if for protection or every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lanier

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Good knife so far, great sheath, Mounts horizontally on belt in center of your back perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: capnpik

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the money, convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of the knife and having it on my belt is super convient and easy to quickly get access to it. Sheath is comfortable on your belt and durable. The rubber around the handle isnt very sturdy and wore off the end in a week from getting in and out of the car and leaning on walls. The blade came with a horrible excuse of an edge, dull with burs but nothing a stone couldnt fix in a minute or 2.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC blade.
customer_reviews.text: What a great little EDC knife! I wanted a concealed blade for riding my motorcycle in remote areas, this fits the bill perfectly, light but sturdy and quick deployment.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Last Resort Knife
customer_reviews.text: Good Self-Defense blade. Sheath dulls the blade quickly, but as a last resort, still better than bare hands. The tip keeps sharp and the handle has a decent grip on it. I still think it could be better with this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sinful Sinister

customer_reviews.title: Nice little knife
customer_reviews.text: Nice little knife. Perfect to Put on your belt. Very sharp when I got it. The sheath it’s nice as well. I use it for the little things, cutting rope, fishing string. Quality seems pretty good. For the price you can’t beat it
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Pettola

customer_reviews.title: Broke before I could even use it!
customer_reviews.text: Blade seemed nice. Went to put it back in the sheath and almost sliced my hand when the sheath broke in half. Wasn't even using any force. I know it's not a super expensive knife, but I'm expecting more from a company like Gerber. Completely unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great knife. Sheath is fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Knife was sharp out of the box. However I’ve only had the knife for 3 days when the sheath broke as I was drawing it for use. I am giving a 4 star for the quality of the knife, but the sheath is a one star due to it breaking on a standard draw.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Good fixed blade
customer_reviews.text: This is my most recent EDC. I wanted a light fixed blade with a slightly lower quality steel so I could resharpen it easily when needed. Holds edge for a decent amount of time, and I almost dont even feel it on my belt.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gilwee

customer_reviews.title: Best conceal carry fixed blade
customer_reviews.text: Second one to buy because I sold a kayak and accidentally left this attached. This is by far the best concealment fixed blade on the market. Highly recommend , the user is allowed to adjust however he or she wishes with the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Anh Vell

customer_reviews.title: Still wear this puppy all the time on the small ...
customer_reviews.text: Still wear this puppy all the time on the small of my back sideways for a quick draw. The rubber on the handle is getting worn down and about 1/8" of the tips snapped off but I guess this is to be expected from a daily use knife from 1.5 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: HalfTspTurboLax

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality! Lays flat against the belt, doesn't get caught on things. Easy to conceal. Easy to release and doesn't fall out on its own!
customer_reviews.author: Nyssa Nevers

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to carry discretely
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to carry discretely when you wear your shirt untucked and to goes below your beltline.
customer_reviews.author: ModeratelyHelpful1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blade but does require some maintenance more often than most others.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome blade, got this one as a work knife because I'd be in a situation where I needed to pull my blade out but couldn't reach into my pocket. Edge retention is a little poor and the case is a bit awkward if you have the knife sit horizontal rather than vertical (I get the handle hooked on stuff more than I'd like), but other than that, probably one of the best fixed blades I've ever owned. I did tear off the rubber coating on the handle, I didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon LaBrasseur

customer_reviews.title: Ghost strike knife
customer_reviews.text: This is such a nice utility knife for work and is very light and well balanced for throwing as well. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Jones

customer_reviews.title: EDC belt knife.
customer_reviews.text: As a fireman I need a knive that can be quickly drawn out. But also not outwardly easily noticed. Seems to be good quality. Blade needs to be touched up on opening.
customer_reviews.author: The Best Husband in the World

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, good size, but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The sheath fit well on the small of my back. The blade was pretty sharp, and the form of the knife fit well with my hand. Only downside, which is kind of a big one, screws on the sheath came off within a few months. Also, the rubber gripping on the handle started peeling quickly. Wore the knife daily for work, but was not handling it enough for it to fall apart like that. If Gerber fixes that, it'd be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jarod

customer_reviews.title: dull Dull DULL
customer_reviews.text: dull Dull DULL!! Bought because I'm hard on folders and assist open knives. After a week the rubber coated grip already ripping/wearing off from getting in and out of the car sitting down etc. Edge needed a lot of work on ye olde whetstone. Sheath a bit clunky to put on your belt but easy to get knife in and out. I like the way the knife feels I your hand. Wish there were better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, willing to buy a second one. Sent link to friends whim really like the product
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Worth your investment
customer_reviews.text: Quality knife with a very secure holster and its light and feels great in my hand that offers a secure and non slip grip. It was a good buy
customer_reviews.author: J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The sheath is built well and the knife is great. I wear it daily with no issues. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tanguma

customer_reviews.title: Love the knife hate the sheath
customer_reviews.text: Blade dulls when removing from the sheath. I don't understand why they put metal brackets in the way of the blade which dulls the blade each time you place it in or remove it from the sheath. I like the sheath but hate having a dull blade.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Quality blade and the sheeth is nice. The only drawback of course being the knife ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality blade and the sheeth is nice. The only drawback of course being the knife can get caught on things if you're not wearring anything to cover it. I haven't had that happen enough to know but it could possible lead to issues down the line if it gets caught enough.
customer_reviews.author: Sentient

customer_reviews.title: ... just received this knife in the mail and I love the concept of mounting this on my belt side ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this knife in the mail and I love the concept of mounting this on my belt side ways as opposed to having a knife in my pocket. I was really disappointed with how Dull this knife is. I couldn't cut a banana with this knife. I expected more from a Gerber knife. I bought several Bear Grylls addition knives and they came nice and sharp. Is it a big deal? Maybe not but how hard is it for them to put a nice edge on a knife?
customer_reviews.author: Pitbull Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Serves as an excellent backup knife! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent backup knife! I wouldn't say this is the knife to cut everything in your path (like camping) cutting branches, thick sticks etc. but a good knife to cut off fishing lines or just in case you get into those crappy situations with a would be robber / an animal attack (You get the ordeal).
customer_reviews.author: Cenon415

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: The horizontal sheath fits so perfectly on my belt that I could easily forget it's even there. The knife seems strong and well made. Together they are perfect for carrying concealed.
customer_reviews.author: L. South

customer_reviews.title: Solution for every problem.
customer_reviews.text: Great little knife for the price! I saw all the reviews about the rubber handle wearing off before I bought and since I've had it, mine started doing the same. To mitigate that, I took 550 cord and wrapped it through the handle which gives it a little extra grip and some pizazz. Worth the money and already contemplating on getting a second one as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: ECS

customer_reviews.title: good concealment with the type of sheath
customer_reviews.text: good set up for the price. knife is slightly short for fighting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good knife, just wish I knew how to make it fit on my vest
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit difficult to return it to its sheath ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit difficult to return it to its sheath. Whatever locking mechanism they have engineered into it means you need to have it just so to get in to set in.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise yes this is a good knife, wont fall out
customer_reviews.text: So I scout carry this when I'm at work, camping and being outdoors when I know ill need a knife. Otherwise yes this is a good knife, wont fall out, good quality and serves a purpose. Also not too big that is overwhelming, I would get this if you were searching for a range knife, hiking knife or fishing knife.
customer_reviews.author: JMero

customer_reviews.title: Great job Gerber!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the perfect conceal carry blade. I wear it flat along my belt in the back and I can’t even tell it’s there. This blade will hold a wicked edge! Great job Gerber!
customer_reviews.author: M. Harper

customer_reviews.title: I liked the right fit in the sheath as I wore ...
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely impressed by this knife when I first got it. I liked the right fit in the sheath as I wore mine horizontal style in front. Very discreet and unoticeable. I was disappointed when I first tried to cut tape off a cardboard box at work. It didn't even cut the tape unless you put more than enough pressure to it. I still wear it but I'll have to try and sharpen it. It just wasn't the "Gerber sharp" I've been so used to. I've always been a Gerber guy and this is my first disappointment by them.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: More of a novelty than a serious weapon
customer_reviews.text: The idea behind the knife I cool. The implementation is pretty bad. Gerber used to do so much better.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Ghoststrike fixed blade knife
customer_reviews.text: Really great knife, exactly what I was looking for. Can wear on a boot, vertically on a belt, great for a backup alternative. Lightweight, & has a adjustable plastic sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Ediger

customer_reviews.title: Seem very concealable which I like and the convertible across the back is a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Seem very concealable which I like and the convertible across the back is a great design even with the secure sheath. I like it just wish it had a little more weight to it or at least longer handle, because it feels like I grab it and thrust but really only three fingers with thumb doing all the work because of the way handle is designed..
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P.

product_meta.title: Gerber Ghoststrike Fixed Blade Knife [30-001005]
product_meta.description: The Ghostrike Series Fixed Blade is an ultra-light self defense knife with a sheath system configurable for low profile or open carry. The modular sheath system can be worn horizontally on the belt or vertically on a belt like a traditional fixed blade knife. Simply detach the belt loops from the grommet holes and arrange them as you please. Made with 420HC steel, the Ghostrike Series Fixed Blade's black ceramic coating offers superior corrosion resistance and minimizes reflective surfaces. Its 3.3 inch fine edge drop point blade serves to slice and rip with precision. The compact skeletal fixed blade is sized for a subtle presence, and can be worn without making a profile against your outer clothing. The rubber over-mold handle features a diamond texture, allowing for a superior grip in critical situations. Know your local laws before you decide how to carry. The Ghostrike Series Fixed Blade knife is proudly made in Portland, OR. Gerber limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Black ceramic coating for minimal reflection + corrosion.
Diamond texture rubber handle for superior grip.
Modular sheath system for concealed or open carry.
Always on hand. Always ready. Never unprepared.
Includes a modular sheath system that can be worn horizontally or vertically
420HC blade steel with black ceramic coating offers superior corrosion resistance
The skeletonized handle allows for a low profile carry
The diamond textured, rubber over-mold handle give exceptional grip in many situations
Overall length: 6.9 inches, Blade length: 3.3 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars938 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
